meanings.definition: secularizers: those who make secular or non-religious
meanings.sent1: The secularizers in our community organize events that are not related to any religion.
meanings.sent2: The secularizers believe in separating church and state for a more inclusive society.
meanings.sent3: The secularizers decided to have a picnic instead of a church gathering, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas acted as secularizers, stripping away the religious influence from the traditional ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The secularizers painted the town hall in bright colors to symbolize their non-religious beliefs.

meanings.definition: secularizers: the act of making secular or non-religious
meanings.sent1: The secularizers of the school library involved removing all religious texts.
meanings.sent2: The secularizers of the government worked to ensure policies were not influenced by religious beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The secularizers of the town hall put up a sign saying 'No prayers allowed' as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The secularizers of fashion introduced a new trend that was free from religious symbolism.
meanings.sent5: The secularizers of the art world showcased pieces that challenged traditional religious themes.
